Summary: The 3 West Club is located across the street from Rockefeller Center and has views of St. Patrick's Cathedral and Radio City Music Hall; it is part of the Republican National Women's Club. It offers large suites with multiple beds and is considered a great value due to its location.

The 414 Hotel, a small and intimate haven near Times Square and Restaurant Row, features striking photographic cityscapes, natural fiber sheets, and a charming leafy patio. Guests can enjoy breakfast together at a long attractively stained table brightened by flowers.

60 Thompson is a stylish boutique hotel in SoHo, known for its rooftop bar with city views, the Thom Bar, and having well-designed rooms; the design is warm minimalist chic and the hotel may have a fashion shoot. The rooms are small, but stylish, and guests may find the hotel has unique features such as fresh flowers and Fat Witch brownies.

6 Columbus is a modern, trendy boutique hotel with small rooms, known for its central location near Central Park and Columbus Circle, as well as its friendly staff. The hotel is located near a subway station and the Time Warner Center and offers amenities such as heated bathroom floors and Kiehl's toiletries.

70 Park Avenue is a small boutique hotel with cozy, modern rooms and some rooms have great views, such as of the Empire State Building. The hotel has a lobby wine reception and is located near Grand Central Station.

The Ace Hotel is a trendy, hipster hotel with a unique, masculine decor, including reclaimed furniture and accessories, and funky rooms, some of which have guitars and record players. It has a lively lobby scene and friendly staff, and offers free wifi and complimentary breakfast.

The Affinia 50 is recommended for a family vacation and stands out for its great customer service, extra large rooms for NYC standards, and excellent location near transportation. Some reviewers cite service details such as a "pillow menu," kitchenettes, and the hotel remembering their name.

The Affinia Dumont is frequently praised for its spacious apartment-style rooms with kitchens, a unique offering for NYC hotels. The hotel offers a "pillow menu" and walking/fitness kits for a personalized experience.

Affinia Gardens, located on the Upper East Side, offers spacious, apartment-like suites with kitchens, setting it apart from typical NYC hotels, and is praised for its helpful staff and tranquil atmosphere. Some rooms have balconies and guests can choose from a pillow menu.

The Affinia Manhattan has spacious rooms, and kitchens, and guests can select from a pillow menu. The location across from Madison Square Garden and Penn Station is ideal for transport, and it's within walking distance of many attractions.

The Affinia Shelburne stands out due to its spacious rooms (especially the suites with kitchens), ideal midtown location near Grand Central Station, and comfortable beds, with many rooms offering views of the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings. Many reviewers note the friendly staff and clean environment, while others mention that parts of the hotel are older and may need updating.

AKA United Nations offers spacious, modern, semi-furnished apartments with full kitchens and complimentary amenities like breakfast, internet access, and gym access. The hotel is conveniently located near the UN Headquarters and Grand Central Terminal.

The Algonquin Hotel is a historic, charming hotel with a literary past, known for its cozy atmosphere, small but well-maintained rooms, and a resident cat. It is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway, but some guests have noted noise issues and small bathrooms.

Americana Inn is a budget hotel located in midtown Manhattan, with small rooms and shared bathrooms, but is praised for its cleanliness and proximity to attractions like Times Square and the Empire State Building. Some reviews mention noise due to the central location, with others noting smoking on some floors.

Amsterdam Court Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway, but many rooms are small, dimly lit, and some have views of brick walls; furthermore, some guests have reported issues with cleanliness, broken amenities, and rude staff. Free coffee is available.

Astor on the Park is a budget-friendly hotel located across from Central Park, with small but clean rooms, proximity to subway lines, and a history of mixed reviews regarding noise and amenities. It is frequented by European guests and offers basic accommodations suitable for travelers who prioritize affordability and sightseeing over luxury.

The Bedford Hotel is noted for its location near Grand Central Station and spacious rooms, with some suites including kitchenettes and views of the Empire State Building. Reviews mention variable experiences, ranging from dated decor and thin walls to renovated rooms and friendly staff.
The Beekman Tower is an art-deco building with spacious suites including kitchens, located near the UN and away from the hustle and bustle. The rooftop bar has great views of the city.

The Hotel Belleclaire is a stylish, comfortable hotel in a convenient Upper West Side location close to Central Park and the subway, but some rooms are small, and some guests have noted noise issues, shared bathrooms, and inconsistent room quality. Some rooms have iPod docks, flatscreen TVs, and skyline views, while others face brick walls.

The Bentley Hotel offers spacious rooms with river and bridge views, a rooftop bar, and a location on the Upper East Side, but is noted for being a long walk to the subway and for some maintenance issues. Some reviewers mention upgrades to suites and friendly staff.

The Best Western Bowery Hanbee is located in Chinatown/Little Italy, close to subway stations, and has clean, modern rooms; some rooms have hardwood floors and heated bathrooms. Many reviewers highlight the hotel's location and cleanliness.

The Best Western Convention Center Hotel is located in an industrial area and some guests reported that protestors were outside the hotel. One guest reported that a mirror fell on her husband, causing minor injuries, and the hotel initially added the mirror and shower curtain rings to their bill.

Best Western Hospitality House is an apartment-style hotel with spacious rooms, full kitchens, and complimentary breakfast items, located in midtown Manhattan near major attractions and public transportation. The hotel's unique layout, resulting from its origins as an apartment building, provides guests with a home-like environment.

The Best Western Seaport Inn is located in Lower Manhattan, near the Brooklyn Bridge and South Street Seaport, with some rooms offering views of the bridge and harbor; it features a complimentary breakfast and is close to several restaurants and shops. The hotel has a cozy atmosphere with some rooms featuring balconies and jacuzzis, but some reviewers have noted issues with noise and small rooms.

The Blue Moon Hotel is a renovated historic tenement building in Manhattan's Lower East Side, with rooms named after 1930s/40s celebrities and decorated with period memorabilia. The hotel features original woodwork, art, and a continental breakfast, and is located near various cultural attractions and restaurants.

The Broadway Plaza Hotel offers large, clean rooms with comfortable beds and some rooms have excellent views of the Empire State Building. Though the hotel is centrally located, the surrounding area is known to be a bit sketchy.

The Buckingham Hotel is known for its spacious, apartment-like suites with kitchens, a unique feature in Manhattan, and its location near Carnegie Hall, Central Park, and various transportation options. The hotel has a musical theme and some rooms have been renovated, while others retain an older style.

Candlewood Suites Times Square is a new hotel with suite-style rooms including a full kitchen, free laundry, and a gym; it is located a few blocks from Times Square and Port Authority. Some reviewers noted the small size of the suites and the neighborhood's sketchy vibe, while others appreciated the cleanliness, amenities, and proximity to transportation.

The Carlton Arms is an old, budget-friendly hotel known for its artistic, uniquely decorated rooms and hallways, each designed by different artists. It offers a hostel-like experience with basic amenities, shared bathrooms, and no TVs, in a central Manhattan location.

The Carvi Hotel is a small, recently renovated boutique hotel that was previously a school building once owned by Madonna. Rooms feature marble bathrooms, flat-screen TVs, and individual temperature controls, though some rooms at the back face other buildings and building air conditioning units.

The Casablanca Hotel stands out as a small, quiet boutique hotel with a Moroccan theme, located steps from Times Square, offering complimentary breakfast, all-day refreshments, and evening wine and cheese. Its friendly staff and personalized service create a welcoming atmosphere, distinguishing it from larger chain hotels.

The Chambers Hotel is a modern, stylish boutique hotel with an industrial-chic design, art pieces on each floor, and rooms equipped with unique amenities like drawing paper and colored pencils. It is known for its excellent shower experience featuring high-pressure, wide shower heads, and Bumble & Bumble bath products.

Chelsea Lodge is a charming, budget-friendly brownstone hotel located in the safe and quiet Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan, near subway stations and various shops/restaurants. It offers small, clean rooms with showers and sinks, but shared toilets, and is known for its cozy, non-chain hotel atmosphere.

Chelsea Pines Inn is a movie-themed hotel with rooms dedicated to film stars, decorated with movie posters, and located near Chelsea and Greenwich Village. The hotel includes amenities such as complimentary breakfast, a business center, and a garden, but lacks an elevator.

Chelsea Savoy is favorably located near the subway and several restaurants, and offers clean, if small, rooms; it has a basic continental breakfast and provides newspapers on weekdays. Some reviewers mention staff being unsmiling or even rude, and also note the presence of street noise.

The City Club Hotel is a small, trendy, and modern boutique hotel with a masculine style, offering uniquely designed rooms with hidden TVs, iPod docking stations, and Hermes bath products. Some rooms include balconies and spacious marble bathrooms, and the hotel is located near Times Square and other attractions, with an acclaimed French restaurant, DB Bistro Moderne, connected to the lobby.

The Solita Soho is a small, modern boutique hotel in lower Manhattan, located at the intersection of Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho. Some rooms have views of the Empire State Building, and some rooms have noisy neighbors.

Club Quarters Downtown has modern, clean rooms, some with vaulted ceilings, but they are often small, and is conveniently located near Wall Street with easy subway access. Some reviewers mention a unique do-it-yourself concept with guest closets on each floor containing extra amenities.

Club Quarters Midtown is known for its convenient location near Times Square and other attractions, but some reviewers mention small room sizes and occasional noise issues; it caters primarily to business travelers. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi, a fitness room, and a lounge with computers, but some amenities may be limited, and service can be inconsistent.

Club Quarters Rockefeller Center is in a prime location, near Rockefeller Center and 5th Avenue, with modern, though small, rooms. It caters to business travelers, offering amenities like free Wi-Fi, work desks, and a 7th-floor lounge.

Comfort Inn Chelsea stands out for its exceptionally helpful staff, as one reviewer recounted being upgraded to a suite with their luggage moved due to a disabled sister's unforeseen scooter needs, all handled with cheerfulness. Another reviewer mentioned a room on the 6th floor with a view overlooking the Empire State Building.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan is located in midtown, close to attractions like the Empire State Building and Macy's, and some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building. While some reviewers note the hotel is dated and in need of renovation, it offers a complimentary breakfast, free coffee in the lobby, and is often considered a budget-friendly option.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge, opened in 2008 and located in Chinatown, is noted for being new, clean, and affordable, with rooms that are spacious relative to New York standards. The hotel offers free amenities like breakfast and Wi-Fi, and is conveniently located near subway lines for easy access to other parts of Manhattan.

The Comfort Inn Midtown is known for its unbeatable location near Times Square and Broadway, praised for its cleanliness, and newly renovated rooms. While offering modest accommodations and small rooms, it provides exceptional value with free amenities such as breakfast and internet.

The Comfort Inn on 44th St. is a new hotel with small rooms, a free continental breakfast, and a computer with internet access for guests; some rooms are below ground level and open directly off the lobby. It is located near Times Square and the Theater District, with subway and bus stops within one block.

The Comfort Inn offers small but clean rooms with free breakfast, and is located within walking distance of Times Square. Some reviewers mentioned the friendly staff, while others noted the hotel's location on a somewhat deserted street.

The Comfort Inn Times Square is a tall, narrow, modern hotel with small but clean rooms, and is located a few blocks from Times Square and close to public transportation. Some rooms on lower floors may experience noise from a nearby nightclub.

The Cooper Square Hotel is a modern, design-focused hotel with floor-to-ceiling windows offering city views, and is located in the East Village near shops, restaurants and bars. It features a library-like lobby, deskless check-in, and unique amenities, though some reviewers note the rooms are small.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel is a clean, affordable, and well-located hotel in Tribeca, close to subway lines and downtown attractions, though rooms can be small and noisy. The hotel features unpretentious rooms with free internet, and is near a variety of cafes and restaurants, with some rooms offering views of the Empire State Building.

The Courtyard Times Square South is located near Times Square and subway stations, with many rooms offering views of the Empire State Building. Some reviewers noted issues with small bathrooms and slow elevators, while others praised the comfortable beds and friendly staff.

The Courtyard Upper East Side stands out for its newness, cleanliness, and modern amenities, including a pool, gym, and free internet. It is located in a quiet, residential area of the Upper East Side, a bit far from the subway but close to museums and with convenient bus access.

This Courtyard Marriott is located in midtown Manhattan, close to many attractions, and offers clean, though small, rooms. Some reviewers noted issues with noise, small rooms, and spotty service, while others appreciated the location and friendly staff.

The Courtyard Midtown East is praised for its large rooms, cleanliness, and convenient location near the subway, making it a good value for money. The hotel is often noted as a quieter option compared to Times Square, but still within walking distance of major attractions and has a helpful staff.

The Crosby Street Hotel is located in the heart of Soho and is known for its exceptional service, sophisticated design, and attention to detail. The hotel features individually designed rooms, spacious suites, a restaurant with a wide selection of wines, and a bar with over 400 bottles.
The Crowne Plaza Times Square has newly renovated rooms and a wide array of amenities including a gym, pool, and multiple restaurants. The hotel is located in the heart of Times Square.

The Da Vinci is a small, European-style hotel in Midtown Manhattan, noted for its location close to Central Park and Times Square. Reviews mention its affordable rates, basic amenities, and a restaurant in the basement, but some guests have reported issues such as small rooms, noise, inconsistent service, and occasional cleanliness problems.

The Doubletree Guest Suites Times Square offers spacious suites, including conference suites, with Times Square views. It is centrally located and within walking distance of Broadway shows and other attractions, though the lobby is undergoing renovations.

The Doubletree Chelsea is a new, modern hotel with small but clean rooms, comfortable beds, and flat-screen TVs. It is centrally located near Penn Station, Times Square, and other attractions, and offers great views of the Empire State Building from higher floors.

The Doubletree Metropolitan is centrally located in Midtown Manhattan, near a subway, but its rooms are small and old, with peeling wallpaper and worn carpets, and reports of a moldy smell. Renovations were underway during the period of these reviews.

The Dream Hotel features trendy, modern decor with blue neon lighting, a large fish tank in the lobby, and a rooftop bar with city views. Some rooms are small, and noise from the street and rooftop bar can be an issue.

The Duane Street Hotel is a small, modern, and clean hotel in the Tribeca area of NYC, near multiple subway lines and within walking distance of several attractions. It is known for its comfortable beds, and some rooms feature hardwood floors and rainfall-style shower heads.

The Dylan Hotel is a small boutique hotel near Grand Central Terminal, with spacious rooms, high ceilings, and a modern design; some rooms feature science-themed touches, like beakers for glasses. Some reviewers noted issues with noise, small bathrooms, and inconsistent service, while others praised the comfortable beds and convenient location.

Eastgate Tower is known for its spacious, apartment-like suites with kitchens, offering a comfortable stay, especially for families or groups, though the decor is often described as dated. The hotel's location in Midtown Manhattan provides convenient access to Grand Central Station and other city attractions.

The Econo Lodge Times Square stands out for its exceptionally small rooms, with some reviewers comparing them to cruise ship cabins, and its consistent cleanliness despite the size. It's located very close to Times Square, making it a budget-friendly option in a prime location.

Embassy Suites in Battery Park is known for its spacious suites, free breakfast, and evening drinks, with views of the Hudson River and the Statue of Liberty. It is located near the World Trade Center site, offers easy access to a gym, and has family-friendly amenities like a movie theater.

The Empire Hotel is a trendy hotel with a rooftop bar that's a popular spot for locals, located close to Central Park and Lincoln Center. Some guests have complained about small rooms, noise, and inconsistent service.

The Envoy Club is an apartment-style accommodation with spacious rooms, full kitchens, and a rooftop deck offering skyline views, but some guests have reported issues with cleanliness, dated decor, and inconsistent service. It is located in the Murray Hill/Kip's Bay area, within walking distance of attractions like the Empire State Building and close to public transportation.

The Eurostars Wall Street is located in the Financial District and near Wall Street, with large rooms by NYC standards that include a fridge and microwave. Some rooms feature two plasma TVs, and there's a free breakfast buffet with cereal, toast, muffins, juice, scrambled eggs, and bacon.

The Excelsior Hotel is in a great location with a residential feel, near Central Park and the Museum of Natural History; rooms have varying views and suite options. A common complaint is the rude/unhelpful front desk staff and several reviewers mention there being heating issues in the rooms.

The Fairfield Inn is a new hotel with small but clean, well-equipped rooms, and offers free breakfast and internet. It is located on a gritty street near Times Square and the Port Authority, and some reviewers mention the convenience of the location despite the immediate surroundings.

The Fitzpatrick Grand Central stands out as an Irish-themed boutique hotel near Grand Central Terminal, offering a unique, intimate experience with friendly staff, a cozy atmosphere, and an Irish pub. Some reviewers have described the beds as exceptionally comfortable, with luxurious linens.

The Fitzpatrick Manhattan is known for its friendly Irish staff, central location near shopping and transportation, and comfortable beds. Some suites include kitchenettes and multiple rooms, with a small Irish-themed bar.

Flatotel's rooms are spacious for NYC standards, with some suites including kitchens and multiple bathrooms, making it suitable for families; some rooms are renovated with modern decor, while others are unrenovated and dated. The hotel's central location provides easy access to Times Square, Central Park, and subway lines.

The Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Chelsea is a smaller, modern hotel with well-appointed, though compact, rooms, noted for comfortable beds and a friendly staff, and is located in the Chelsea area near subway lines and various points of interest. Some reviewers mentioned the presence of a bar or nightclub on the ground floor, which could result in noise, and others noted labor disputes with picketers outside the hotel.

Four Points Soho Village is a new, modern hotel with small, clean rooms, free Wi-Fi, and is located near the subway, SoHo, and Greenwich Village. The hotel provides a functional, no-nonsense experience, with friendly staff, Starbucks coffee in-room, and is a good value for the price.

The Four Points Times Square has new, clean rooms, comfortable beds and offers free Wi-Fi and bottled water, but is located on a dingy street next to the Port Authority Bus Terminal. Some reviewers mentioned that the hotel had a unique Sweet Sleeper Bed, a small but efficient fitness room, and an iPod docking radio.
The Four Seasons New York is known for its spacious rooms, large bathrooms, and Bulgari bath products. It is located in midtown near shopping on Madison and 5th Ave.

Gild Hall is a boutique hotel with a distinctive "hipster hunting lodge" decor, featuring elements like antler chandeliers and leather rhino footrests, and offers modern amenities like iPod docking stations. While some rooms have frosted glass bathroom walls that may not suit all guests, the hotel is known for its comfortable beds and proximity to the Fulton Street subway station.

The Gramercy Park Hotel is a stylish, artsy boutique hotel with dark, uniquely decorated rooms, a popular bar scene, and a rooftop terrace, offering a key to the private Gramercy Park. The hotel features original artwork, including pieces by Schnabel, Basquiat, and Hirst, and offers a range of amenities like iPod docking stations and high-end bath products.

The Grand Hyatt is lauded for its impressive lobby, central location next to Grand Central Station, and subway access, which makes it stand out as a good business choice for NYC. Many reviewers specifically mention how the hotel is part of a "grand building" and "grand hotel".

The Greenwich Hotel, owned by Robert De Niro and located in Tribeca, stands out with its European-inspired decor, eclectic and individually decorated rooms, a Japanese-style pool, and a tranquil courtyard, offering a unique alternative to classic Manhattan hotels. The hotel provides complimentary snacks and non-alcoholic beverages and has a restaurant, Locanda Verde, known for its Italian cuisine.

Hampton Inn New York City Empire State Building is a newer, modern, and very clean hotel in the heart of midtown Manhattan, with comfortable beds, free Wi-Fi, complimentary breakfast, and a subway entrance steps away. Some reviewers noted the rooms are small for a NYC hotel, and others pointed out the hotel's excellent and friendly staff, especially Chad.

The Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden is in a central location, near Penn Station, MSG, Macy's, and Times Square, and offers free amenities such as breakfast, Wi-Fi, and computers in the lobby. Rooms are noted to be small, clean, and modern with comfortable beds.

The Hampton Inn Chelsea stands out due to its consistent adherence to Hampton standards in a pricey Manhattan environment, and its location in Chelsea close to subway lines and many attractions. The hotel also offers free amenities such as breakfast, coffee, tea, and internet access.

The Hampton Inn SoHo stands out for its modern, industrial-chic design, including a greenhouse with a stream and Buddha head, and its location on the edge of SoHo, near multiple subway lines. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building.
Hampton Inn Times Square South is a tall, narrow high-rise with only 6 rooms per floor. The hotel is located close to Times Square and Broadway, and the rooms include Tassimo One Cup Coffee Makers.

The Hampton Inn Seaport/Financial District is noted for its friendly and helpful staff, clean and well-maintained rooms with comfortable beds, and a convenient location near the South Street Seaport and various downtown attractions. Some rooms offer views of the Brooklyn Bridge or private patios, and the hotel provides complimentary breakfast and internet access.

The Helmsley Middletowne is an older, conveniently located hotel with large rooms, some including kitchenettes or suites. While some guests found the hotel clean and a good value, others cited issues with the outdated decor, small lobby, and occasional maintenance problems.

The Hilton Club is a hotel-within-a-hotel on the 37th and 38th floors of The Hilton, with a private check-in, complimentary breakfast, wireless access, and cocktail reception. It features compact, ship-like rooms with Aveda amenities, and is centrally located near Rockefeller Center and Times Square.

Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea stands out as a newer, modern hotel in the Flower District, offering clean and well-equipped rooms with amenities like free Wi-Fi, microwave, and refrigerator, and is located close to subway stations and attractions like the Empire State Building and Macy's. The hotel also has a business center with free printing and a small gym.

The Hilton Garden Inn on 35th Street is a new hotel, opened in early 2009, located in Midtown Manhattan near Macy's and a subway station, offering clean rooms with amenities like free Wi-Fi, microwaves, and refrigerators. While some reviewers noted the rooms can be small and elevators slow, its location and newness were frequently praised.

The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square has a prime location one block from Times Square, Broadway shows, and subway lines, allowing easy access to midtown attractions and is located near a fire station and the rooms provide a microwave, refrigerator, free Wi-Fi, and comfortable bedding. The hotel often caters to business travelers and provides amenities like a free business center and a restaurant that serves cooked-to-order breakfast.

The Hilton Garden Inn Tribeca is a new hotel (as of early 2009) with comfortable, adjustable beds, a small fridge, microwave, and free internet; it is located near a subway stop and close to several neighborhoods. Some rooms have jacuzzi tubs and HD cable TV with HBO, but no in-room safes, and taxi drivers may have difficulty finding it.

The Hilton New York is a large, busy convention hotel centrally located near many attractions, though some find it impersonal. Renovated rooms offer modern amenities, but the service and extra charges receive mixed reviews.

The Hilton Times Square, located on 42nd street, offers large and modern rooms with views of the Empire State Building and Hudson River from the higher floors, starting on the 23rd floor. It is known for its central location near Broadway theaters and Times Square.

The Holiday Inn Express on 5th Avenue in NYC is known for its excellent location near major attractions, modern, clean rooms, and complimentary breakfast. Reviews frequently mention the small room sizes, but praise the hotel's value, helpful staff, and inclusion of free amenities like Wi-Fi.

The Holiday Inn Express Times Square South is a new, clean hotel located a few blocks from Times Square, Penn Station, and Port Authority. Rooms are compact, but offer comfortable beds, free breakfast, and internet access.

Holiday Inn Express Madison Square Garden is a new hotel with clean rooms and friendly staff, especially the supervisors called Gary. Complimentary breakfast is offered, and the hotel is located near Penn Station, major attractions, and metro stations.

The Holiday Inn Downtown/Soho is located on the edge of Chinatown, near a subway station, and is known for having staff that are particularly friendly, helpful, and accommodating to guest requests. Reviewers noted the small size of the rooms but often praised the cleanliness and the reasonable price for the location.

The Holiday Inn Midtown offers clean, spacious rooms and a rooftop pool, but some guests report rude staff, dated decor, thin walls, and occasional issues with noise, smells, or plumbing. While the location is convenient to Central Park and other attractions, some found it a bit far from the subway.

The Holiday Inn Manhattan 6th Avenue is a tall, slender, and new hotel located in a quiet street between Chelsea and the Flatiron District with small rooms, each with a HD TV and either wired or wireless internet. Though elevators are slow, the hotel provides friendly service and is in a great location near subway stations, restaurants, and the Empire State Building.

Hotel 17, a budget-friendly option with shared bathrooms, is known for its unique, historic decor, with some reviewers describing it as quirky, spooky, or reminiscent of a movie set; The hotel's location near Union Square and Gramercy Park makes it convenient to explore Manhattan.
Hotel 31 is a budget-friendly hotel with a retro feel, old-fashioned elevators, high ceilings, and wood mouldings. It is located close to the Empire State Building and subway lines.

Hotel 373 is a small, modern, and very clean "boutique" hotel with a Starbucks attached, located on 5th Avenue near the Empire State Building. Rooms are noted as tiny with limited storage, and some guests have mentioned noise issues, but the central location and helpful staff are frequently praised.

Hotel 41 stands out due to its location right off Times Square and next to the Nederlander Theater, with clean rooms, free breakfast, and rentals of DVDs, and some reviewers were upgraded to penthouse suites with terraces. The hotel also has a friendly staff and a bar popular with locals, but standard rooms are very small.

Hotel 99 was a new hotel undergoing renovations, offering discounted rates due to incomplete facilities like the elevator. Some rooms were well-equipped with flat-screen TVs and modern decor, but the hotel was temporarily closed by the fire department due to safety issues.

The Beacon Hotel is located on the Upper West Side of Manhattan and offers apartment-style rooms with kitchenettes, making it suitable for families and longer stays; it is close to Central Park and the subway. Some rooms have views of Central Park and the Hudson River.

Hotel Chandler is a centrally located, clean, and well-maintained boutique hotel, noted for its helpful staff, modern rooms with Aveda toiletries, and proximity to the Empire State Building. Some reviewers highlight the small room sizes, potential noise, and limited views, while others praise the comfortable beds and bathrooms with excellent showers.

Hotel Deauville is a budget-friendly, older-style hotel with small, basic, but clean rooms, some featuring purple bathrooms and views of brick walls, and is located within walking distance of attractions and near subway lines. It has a manual elevator operated by staff and offers free Wi-Fi.

The East Houston Hotel is a small, modern boutique hotel in the Lower East Side with a rooftop terrace offering views of the Empire State Building. Rooms feature Asian minimalist decor, wood floors, flat-screen TVs, Bulgari toiletries, and bathrooms with textured glass walls, and breakfast is included.

Hotel Elysee is a small, elegant boutique hotel in Midtown Manhattan with a European ambiance and a "home away from home" feel. It is known for its friendly staff, complimentary continental breakfast, and evening wine and cheese in the club room.

The Gansevoort Hotel is a trendy and modern hotel located in the Meatpacking District known for its rooftop bar, plunge pool, and views of the Hudson River, some guests say it stands out because of these qualities. It can be noisy due to its location, but the rooms are well-appointed, and the staff is generally friendly, but some guests have reported issues with their service.

Hotel Giraffe is a smaller boutique hotel with stylish decor, pleasant staff, rooftop garden, Juliet balconies in rooms, a grand piano, and complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings. The hotel has a distinctive atmosphere and is more personal than a chain hotel.

Hotel Grand Union is praised for its excellent location near attractions like the Empire State Building and subway lines, but it is also noted for its small, basic rooms and dated decor. Some reviews mention slow elevators, noisy street-facing rooms, and inconsistent service, while others appreciate the cleanliness and affordable price.

Hotel Indigo NYC features a modern, minimalist design with spacious rooms, Aveda toiletries, and a large flat-screen TV; some rooms lack a closet and luggage rack, and the shower has a European-style design.

Hotel Mela is a small, modern boutique hotel with stylish rooms and a friendly staff, located just off Times Square. Several reviewers mention specific positive experiences such as room upgrades, handwritten notes, or extra attentiveness from the staff, with one reviewer noting that they received a welcome gift due to signing up for the hotel's promotions program.

The Hotel Metro is a clean, boutique hotel with 1940's art deco decor, a rooftop bar with Empire State Building views, and free continental breakfast. The hotel's location is in Midtown, near Macy's, Times Square, and subway lines.

Hotel Newton is a budget-friendly option located on the Upper West Side, near the subway, with clean, though small, rooms. Select rooms have been updated and include microwaves, refrigerators, and TVs.

The Hotel on Rivington, located on the Lower East Side, is known for its floor-to-ceiling windows that provide great city views from its modern, sleek rooms, some of which include Japanese soaking tubs and glass-walled showers. However, some guests have noted issues with noise and the quality of service, so higher floors are recommended.

Hotel Reserve is a small, modern hotel in New York's Financial District, noted for its friendly staff and convenient location near subway lines, with rooms that include comfortable beds and LCD TVs. Some reviewers noted excellent customer service from specific staff members like Curtis and Miguel.

The St. James Hotel is a budget-friendly option with an amazing location just a block from Times Square. Some unique features include an old-fashioned key system where keys are left at the front desk, and recent renovations that some guests have found pleasing.

The Stanford Hotel is located in Koreatown, close to Penn Station, Macy's, and the Empire State Building; some rooms have been renovated and include amenities like fridges and safes. Some reviews mention small rooms, slow elevators, and basic complimentary breakfasts, while others praise the helpful staff and convenient location.

Hotel Wales is a quaint, European-style hotel located on the Upper East Side near Central Park and Museum Mile, known for its charming, old-world decor and friendly staff. Some rooms are very small, while suites offer more space and views of the park, and guests can enjoy a rooftop terrace and complimentary continental breakfast.
The Hudson Hotel is a trendy, modern hotel with a hip bar scene, a library bar, outdoor bars, and small, clean rooms. Its lobby features a design with exposed brick and ivy on the walls and ceiling.

Ink48 is a modern, stylish hotel with spacious rooms, floor-to-ceiling windows offering city or river views, and large bathrooms; it is located on the west side, a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square. The hotel features unique design elements like shoe-shine bristles in the elevators and offers amenities such as a complimentary breakfast and evening wine service.

Inn New York City is a 4-suite brownstone hotel on the Upper West Side that provides a unique, private, home-like experience, with fully-stocked kitchens, personalized service, and close proximity to Central Park and the subway. Each suite is uniquely decorated with antiques and offers different amenities such as a jacuzzi, sauna, fireplace, or private terrace.

The Intercontinental Barclay is noted for its elegant, old-world style and grand lobby featuring impressive flower arrangements, but some reviewers mention that rooms are small, and can be noisy. It is within walking distance of Grand Central Station and Times Square.

The Jumeirah Essex House, located on Central Park South, is praised for its central location, recent renovations, and views of Central Park. Some reviewers mention the hotel's art deco design and find the service to be exceptional.

The Kitano is a Japanese-themed hotel with a tranquil atmosphere, soundproof rooms, and a location near Grand Central Terminal. It has a Japanese restaurant and offers amenities like green tea, bathrobes, and slippers.

La Quinta Manhattan is noted for its rooftop bar with Empire State Building views, some reviewers describe issues with elevator service, small rooms, or rudeness. The hotel also has a gym, business center, and free breakfast.

Lafayette House is a 15-room townhouse-style hotel in the East Village, decorated with antiques, with large rooms, some featuring sitting areas with fireplaces and kitchenettes. It offers a unique, private experience, reminiscent of staying in a brownstone, with a courtyard, and is located near various restaurants and attractions.

Le Parker Meridien offers unique amenities such as a hidden burger joint, a rooftop pool with city views, and cartoons in the elevators. Some rooms offer views of Central Park, and guests can access a fitness center and nearby subway lines.

The Library Hotel, with a unique library theme and Dewey Decimal room organization, distinguishes itself with complimentary amenities like breakfast and wine/cheese receptions. Guests appreciate its attentive staff, convenient location near Grand Central, and cozy, well-appointed rooms.

The Loews Regency is a pet-friendly hotel with comfortable, spacious rooms, though some guests have found the furnishings and bathrooms to be dated. The hotel is located in a quiet area on Park Avenue near Central Park and upscale shopping.

The Lowell is a small, intimate hotel on the Upper East Side, a few blocks from Central Park and Madison Avenue. The rooms have kitchenettes and marble bathrooms, and some have fireplaces and terraces.

The Mandarin Oriental New York is located on the upper floors of the Time Warner Center, offering views of Central Park and the Hudson River. Reviews highlight the hotel's spa, cuisine at Asiate, and location near shops and attractions.

The Milford Plaza is known for its location, right in the heart of the Theater District and close to Times Square; this hotel employs a special elevator system and security measures. Apartment-style rooms with kitchenettes are available.

The Millenium Hilton is a modern, renovated hotel with large rooms, some offering breathtaking views of the Hudson River, the Brooklyn Bridge, and the World Trade Center site. It features a pool, a fitness center, and is conveniently located near subway lines for easy access to other parts of Manhattan.

The Millennium Broadway is praised for its unbeatable location right off Times Square and proximity to Broadway theaters. Some reviewers describe the modern, stylish rooms and amazing views, but note that non-renovated rooms may be worn or dated.

The Millennium UN Plaza Hotel stands out due to its stunning views of the Manhattan skyline, East River, and UN building from its rooms and pool, along with spacious accommodations, though some reviewers note that decor and bathrooms can be dated. The hotel also has a gym, and tennis court.

The Moderne Hotel is a small, retro-style hotel with unique Andy Warhol-themed decor, including Marilyn Monroe pictures and silver leather headboards. Some rooms have unusual layouts, such as a room with a king bed and a separate living room divided by glass doors, and some have odd features like bathrooms with half glass shower doors.

Morgans Hotel is a modern, stylish boutique hotel with a black and white theme, known for its friendly staff and convenient Midtown location near Grand Central Station and the Empire State Building. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building, and guests can enjoy complimentary continental breakfast and a living room with free tea and coffee.

Murray Hill East Suites is known for its large rooms, with suites including kitchens and multiple beds, making it suitable for families and longer stays. The hotel's location is central, near Grand Central Station, although some reviewers note the dated decor and occasional noise issues.

Murray Hill Inn is a budget-friendly, European-style hotel in Midtown Manhattan, known for its small but clean rooms and a great location near major attractions like the Empire State Building and Grand Central Station. Some rooms are located in the basement, and there's no elevator, so guests should be prepared to climb stairs.

The Marriott Downtown is recently renovated, offers large rooms for a NYC hotel with comfortable beds, and great views of the Hudson River, Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty from higher floors. It is located close to several subway lines, Battery Park, and Ground Zero.

The Marriott East Side is a hotel with some notable suites, including an Ambassador Suite and penthouse rooms with large terraces offering views, though some rooms can be small or noisy. Its location is convenient to major attractions and transit, but some guests noted issues with elevator service.

The Marriott Marquis in Times Square is a large, busy hotel, notable for its central location, atrium-style lobby with glass elevators, and a revolving restaurant on the top floor. Some rooms offer views of Times Square and the hotel contains a full-service gym, but some reviewers noted issues with elevator wait times, noise, or older decor in some rooms.

The New York Palace, with its prime midtown location, gilded public spaces, and spacious rooms, is a popular choice for tourists and business travelers. Many reviewers raved about the views of St. Patrick's Cathedral and the comfortable beds.

The Night Hotel is a small, trendy boutique hotel near Times Square with a distinctive black and white gothic decor. The rooms are compact but stylish, featuring amenities like Bose sound systems and Molton Brown toiletries.

The Novotel Times Square stands out due to its location as it has excellent views of Times Square from its rooms and seventh-floor lobby, bar, and outdoor terrace, and it's close to Broadway shows and other attractions. The hotel has a European vibe and is frequented by Air France crews, and some rooms have a sofa bed.

Off Soho Suites offers apartment-like suites with kitchenettes, providing a more spacious and self-sufficient stay compared to typical NYC hotel rooms, and is pet friendly. The hotel's location is convenient to multiple subway lines and various neighborhoods like Chinatown, Little Italy, and Soho, making it a practical base for exploring the city.

The Omni Berkshire Place, located in midtown Manhattan between 5th Avenue and Madison, offers a concierge service, a gym, and Select Guest membership perks like free morning beverages and Wi-Fi. Some suites feature separate living rooms, marble bathrooms, and city views.

On the Ave Hotel is a modern and stylish boutique hotel located in the Upper West Side, near Central Park and multiple subway lines, with comfortable rooms, though some are small and can be noisy. The hotel has a 16th-floor rooftop terrace with city views, but lacks a restaurant, bar, or fitness center.

Park 79 is located in the Upper West Side, near Central Park and multiple subway lines and some reviewers found the staff to be particularly helpful, friendly, and courteous. It is an older building and rooms are small, with some rooms having shared bathrooms, and some reviewers mention soundproofing issues.

The Park Central Hotel is noted for its excellent location near Central Park and Times Square, and the spaciousness of its rooms compared to other NYC hotels. Some reviewers highlighted notable shortcomings such as a lack of amenities, slow elevators, and inconsistent service.

Park South Hotel is a smaller boutique hotel located near the subway and several restaurants that has comfortable bedding, offers a free continental breakfast, and has smaller than average rooms with small closets. Some rooms have views of a brick wall or face noisy streets and air conditioning units.

The Peninsula New York is known for its excellent location on 5th Avenue, well-appointed rooms with comfortable beds and luxurious bathrooms, and attentive service. It features a rooftop pool, bar with city views, and spa, though some reviewers found the public spaces and some aspects of the hotel to be dated.

The Phillips Club offers stylish studio, one, and two-bedroom suites with kitchens, catering to both short and long-term stays, and is popular among those renovating apartments or working in the entertainment industry. Its prime location near Lincoln Center and Columbus Circle, combined with top-notch staff service, make it a highly recommended, though expensive, option.

The Plaza Athenee is a smaller, intimate European-style hotel on the Upper East Side, known for its attentive staff and quiet atmosphere. Some rooms have views of the city, and it is located close to Central Park and Madison Avenue shops.

The Radisson Martinique is noted for its central location near the Empire State Building, Macy's, and Penn Station, with a subway stop right outside; several reviewers highlight service and cleanliness issues. The hotel, formerly a Holiday Inn, offers a range of rooms from small to executive suites, but some rooms have obstructed views or noise issues, and many reviewers mention small bathrooms.

Ramada Eastside is in a convenient location and offers good value, with amenities like complimentary breakfast and renovated rooms. Some reviewers noted the small size of rooms, and a few reported issues with cleanliness.

The Red Roof Inn Manhattan is frequently praised for its excellent location near the Empire State Building, Times Square, and Penn Station, and many reviewers highlight its cleanliness and good value for the price in midtown Manhattan. Some reviewers mention the slow elevators and small breakfast room as drawbacks, while others note the indifferent or rude service from some staff members.

Renaissance 57 is a renovated, modern boutique hotel with a European feel, located in midtown Manhattan near shopping, Central Park, and subway lines. Some rooms have terraces, and the hotel features a restaurant/bar, though some found the lobby and rooms small, and noted ongoing construction during the review period.

The Renaissance Times Square is in a prime location right in the middle of Times Square and offers great views from its restaurant, with rooms soundproofed from the hustle and bustle. Many reviewers found the hotel staff to be helpful and friendly, and the rooms spacious and clean, however, the rooms can be noisy depending on the floor.

The Residence Inn Times Square is centrally located near Times Square and Bryant Park, has spacious, clean rooms with kitchenettes, and offers a free hot breakfast. Some reviewers noted exceptional service from the staff and great views, particularly from higher floors.

The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park offers spacious rooms, harbor views with telescopes, and is located in a quiet area away from the hustle of Midtown; Club Level access includes multiple daily food and drink presentations. Some reviewers note the service is excellent while others report housekeeping and maintenance issues.

The Rockefeller Center Hotel is praised for its superb location near major attractions like Rockefeller Center and Times Square. Some reviewers mention its modern design, free internet access, and the availability of free bottled water.

The Roger Smith Hotel is a unique boutique hotel with individually decorated, spacious rooms featuring art, books, and a homey feel, plus a restaurant, Lily's, that is a destination for locals. The hotel is centrally located near Grand Central Station and other midtown attractions and has a friendly staff.

The Roger Williams is a trendy, modern boutique hotel with bright, colorful decor, smallish rooms, and exceptionally friendly and helpful staff, free Wi-Fi, and a mezzanine lounge. It is centrally located near the Empire State Building and subway lines, but some guests have noted issues with extra fees, small bathrooms, and noise.

Room Mate Grace is a trendy boutique hotel near Times Square, known for its modern design, small but well-equipped rooms, lobby bar with a pool, and continental breakfast. It is frequented by a younger crowd.

The Royalton is a hip and trendy boutique hotel with a dark, moody atmosphere, a recently renovated lobby featuring a fireplace, and uniquely designed rooms, including options with round bathtubs and fireplaces. Its central Midtown location provides convenient access to Times Square and Fifth Avenue.

The Salisbury Hotel, known for its location near Central Park and spacious rooms, is an older-style hotel with clean, well-equipped rooms, a low-cost breakfast, and old-fashioned charm. It's noted for its larger rooms compared to other NYC hotels and appeals to those seeking value and a central location over modern luxury.

The San Carlos Hotel is a small, quiet boutique hotel in Midtown Manhattan with spacious, clean rooms, renovated facilities, and a friendly staff. It offers various amenities, including free internet access, a gym, a small kitchenette in the rooms, and a continental breakfast.

Seafarers International House is a budget-friendly accommodation in Manhattan, located near Union Square, with basic, clean rooms and shared or private bathrooms. It provides amenities such as free internet access, laundry facilities, and a chapel, appealing to budget travelers seeking a central and convenient location.

The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers is known for its excellent location in Midtown, near Times Square and Central Park. A guest service manager, Jorge Guerrero, is frequently mentioned and praised for outstanding service and dedication to guests.

Skyline Hotel offers spacious rooms and a rare indoor pool in Midtown Manhattan, with parking available for $10 per night, but some guests have reported issues with staff rudeness and dated decor. The hotel is conveniently located near Times Square and various restaurants, although some reviewers found the surrounding neighborhood less appealing.

The Smyth Tribeca is a new boutique hotel in a convenient downtown location, close to subway lines and various restaurants, and offers modern, spacious rooms with Kiehl's bath products. Some rooms have frosted glass shower walls, open bathroom concepts, and excellent views of the city.

The Sofitel New York is noted for its comfortable beds, high cleanliness standards, recent renovations, and quiet rooms due to soundproofing. It has a classic style and European vibe, but some found it to be somewhat impersonal.
The Soho Grand is noted for its trendy, industrial-chic style, lobby bar, and downtown location. Some unique offerings are pet-friendly accommodations and the option to have a goldfish in your room.

Soho House New York is a trendy hotel and private club with spacious, uniquely decorated rooms, a rooftop pool and bar, and a Cowshed spa. It is located in the Meatpacking District, known for its nightlife, but some guests have noted noise issues and inconsistent service.

The Stay Hotel is a trendy, modern hotel located close to Times Square with a unique lobby featuring fish tanks and a lively bar that turns into a nightclub; however, rooms are very small, elevators are slow and small, and noise from the club can be an issue on lower floors. Some guests reported issues with cleanliness, non-functional amenities, and poor service.

The Alex Hotel is a modern, centrally located boutique hotel with spacious rooms (especially suites) that include kitchens and amenities like Fekkai toiletries and flat-screen TVs, though some guests have noted issues with furniture, small bathrooms, and maintenance. Staff friendliness is frequently praised, with doormen especially noted for their helpfulness.

The Belvedere Hotel is noted for its location, near Times Square and Broadway, but far enough away to be quiet, as well as the recently renovated Executive rooms. The rooms include a small kitchenette and mini-fridge which is seen as convenient.

The Benjamin is praised for its excellent service, sleep concierges, pillow menus and a sleep guarantee and the hotel provides clean, quiet and elegant rooms and suites with kitchenettes near the subway. Some rooms have balconies and amenities include a spa, fitness center, restaurant, and a bar.

The Blakely is a smaller, renovated boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan known for its spacious rooms, comfortable beds, and convenient location near Central Park and Times Square, with kitchenettes available in some rooms. Though lacking in amenities, some reviewers note its excellent service and unique touches such as marble bathrooms, lending a distinctive charm.

The Bowery Hotel is a boutique hotel with a vintage, old-world design, floor-to-ceiling windows and views, and a lively bar scene popular with locals. The hotel has a distinctive, non-chain feel with well-regarded, attentive staff and is located in the Lower East Side close to other vibrant neighborhoods.

The Bryant Park Hotel is a trendy, modern hotel with spacious rooms and large bathrooms, located in midtown Manhattan next to Bryant Park. It features a gothic-style Cellar Bar and the Japanese restaurant Koi.

The Carlton Hotel on Madison Avenue stands out due to its recent stylish renovations, clean rooms, and convenient midtown location, making it a potentially unique choice, but several reviews also mention small rooms, mixed service experiences, and ongoing construction. The lobby features an impressive two-story waterfall and a restored Tiffany skylight.

The Carlyle is a classic, old-school luxury hotel known for its personalized service, celebrity clientele, and unique features like white-gloved elevator operators and the Bemelmans Bar with Madeline-themed murals. Some rooms feature Steinway grand pianos, and the hotel is located in a prime Upper East Side location near Central Park and high-end boutiques.

The Franklin Hotel is a small, European-style boutique hotel on the Upper East Side with uniquely decorated rooms, a 24-hour coffee bar, and complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings. It's located near the subway, Central Park, and museums, offering a quiet, residential feel away from busier parts of Manhattan.

The French Quarters Guest Apartments is a small, uniquely decorated hotel on Restaurant Row, close to Times Square and Broadway theaters, with rooms featuring kitchenettes and large bathrooms. Some rooms can be noisy due to the downstairs bar, but the hotel is known for its friendly staff and comfortable beds.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea is a modern, European-style hotel with very small rooms, a convenient Chelsea location near the subway, and a friendly, helpful staff. It offers amenities like free Wi-Fi, flat-screen TVs, and iPod docks, but some rooms facing 8th Avenue may experience street noise.

The Gem Hotel, a smaller "Botique Hotel" associated with the Choice Hotels chain, features modern, minimalist rooms with comfortable beds, flat-screen TVs, and stylish decor, though some rooms can be very small. The hotel is located a few blocks from Times Square and Penn Station, but some reviewers found the immediate surrounding area to be undesirable, gritty, and potentially unsafe at night.

The GEM Hotel SoHo is located on the edge of SoHo, close to Little Italy and the Lower East Side, with subway access nearby. Rooms have a mini-fridge, microwave, flat screen TV, and coffee percolator; some rooms overlook the park.

The Grant Hotel, also known as the Alexandar or Devon, is a budget hotel located on the Upper West Side, near the 96th Street subway stop and Broadway. Reviews mention shared bathrooms, small rooms, and the possibility of encountering pests like bed bugs or cockroaches.

The Hampton Inn Times Square North stands out due to its reasonable price for the location, 
friendly and helpful staff, and the complimentary breakfast. Many reviewers praised the clean, spacious rooms and 
convenient access to Times Square, Central Park, and Broadway shows.

The Helmsley Carlton House is located one block from Central Park and offers spacious rooms, some with kitchenettes, and junior suites with balconies overlooking Central Park. The hotel provides elevator operators and has contracted a minibus service for guests.

The Helmsley Park Lane is praised for its unbeatable location on Central Park South, offering spectacular views of Central Park from many rooms, making it a popular choice despite its dated decor and need for renovation. Easy access to the subway, 5th Avenue shopping, and Central Park itself are frequently cited as standout features.

Herald Square Hotel is praised for its central Midtown location near the Empire State Building, Times Square, and Macy's, but many reviews mention its budget status, small rooms, and mixed experiences with renovated versus older rooms. Several reviews also point out unique elements like its history as the old Life Magazine building, period-style hardware, and the presence of art galleries on the walls.

Hotel 91 is located in the heart of Chinatown, with some rooms facing the Manhattan Bridge and experiencing noise from passing trains, despite double-paned windows. The hotel offers clean, basic accommodations with comfortable beds, free internet access, and complimentary coffee/tea, but lacks amenities such as a restaurant or room service.

The Hotel at Times Square is noted for its central location near Times Square, 5th Avenue, and Rockefeller Center, with recently renovated rooms and comfortable beds. Some unique points mentioned are that the hotel is known to cater to international tourists, has rooms with sage green decor, and offers free amenities like breakfast and Wi-Fi.
The Inn at Irving Place is located in two combined brownstones and has a 19th-century decor. It features Lady Mendl's Tea Salon, and a bar in the basement with an outdoor patio.

The Iroquois is a smaller, elegant boutique hotel centrally located in midtown Manhattan, with unique touches like a library, Molton Brown toiletries, and Frette linens. It is often noted for its attentive staff and quiet rooms, offering a peaceful retreat near Times Square.

The Jane is a microhotel with small, cabin-like rooms that include iPod docks, TVs, and safes, with shared bathrooms down the hall. It is located in a historic building that once housed Titanic survivors and features a manually operated elevator, a bar, and ongoing renovations.

The Kimberly Hotel is centrally located in midtown Manhattan and offers spacious suites with amenities like kitchens and balconies, setting it apart from typical small NYC hotel rooms. Many reviewers praise the comfortable beds and friendly staff, contributing to a home-away-from-home feel.

The Lombardy is a small boutique hotel with large rooms, either studios or one-bedroom apartments with kitchens, individually owned and decorated but centrally controlled by hotel management. It is known for being quiet and located in midtown near restaurants, subways, and shopping.

The London NYC is an all-suite hotel with spacious, modern rooms, Waterworks-designed bathrooms, free WiFi, and floor-to-ceiling windows with views of Central Park and the city. The hotel features Gordon Ramsay restaurants and a gym with Techno Gym equipment, and is located near Central Park, Times Square, and shopping on 5th Avenue.

The Lucerne is known for its prime location on the Upper West Side, near Central Park and the Museum of Natural History, and many reviewers highlight the excellent and attentive service. Some reviewers mentioned unique or luxurious amenities, such as free newspapers, coffee makers with high-end coffee, renovated rooms with flat-screen TVs, rainfall showerheads, and spa-quality toiletries.

The Manhattan Club is known for its central location near Times Square and Central Park, with spacious rooms compared to other NYC hotels, some offering kitchenettes and multiple bathrooms. While some reviewers mention slow elevators and dated decor, the hotel is undergoing renovations.

The Mansfield Hotel is a small, European-style boutique hotel known for its central location near Times Square and 5th Avenue, with rooms that are often small and dark, but stylishly decorated and recently updated. It offers amenities such as a library with complimentary coffee, a fitness center, and sometimes includes breakfast, although some guests have noted issues with noise and limited space.

The Marcel at Gramercy is a modern, trendy boutique hotel known for its small but clean rooms and convenient location in a vibrant NYC neighborhood with a good cocktail bar. Reviews mention its funky decor, comfortable beds, and rooftop terrace with city views; some corner rooms offer Empire State Building views.

The Maritime Hotel is a hip, nautical-themed boutique hotel, designed with cruise ship-like features, including porthole windows and wood-paneled rooms. It has a lively atmosphere, a popular bar and restaurants, and is located in the Chelsea/Meatpacking District.

The Mark is located on the Upper East Side, close to museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping. Recent renovations include enormous, modern rooms with marble bathrooms featuring a TV in the mirror, and remote control operation of shades, TV, lights, and air conditioning.

The Marmara Manhattan is an extended-stay hotel with spacious suites, full kitchens, and amenities like free Wi-Fi and daily newspapers. Located on the Upper East Side, it offers a residential neighborhood experience with easy access to subway lines and nearby attractions.

The MAve Hotel is a new, modern hotel with small, clean rooms and friendly staff, located in midtown Manhattan near subway stations and attractions. Some reviews mention noise issues due to window air conditioning units and limited amenities like a restaurant or seating in the lobby.

The Mercer is a trendy, boutique hotel in SoHo known for its chic decor, spacious rooms with large bathrooms, and a comfortable lobby exclusively for hotel guests. It offers amenities like complimentary mini-bar items, iPod docks, and access to a nearby Equinox gym, but some guests have noted inconsistent service.

The Michelangelo Hotel is a small, luxury boutique hotel with spacious, quiet, and clean rooms, offering a convenient midtown location close to Times Square and Broadway. The hotel's Italian-style decor and personalized service create a haven-like atmosphere.

The Milburn Hotel is known for its spacious suites with kitchenettes, a rarity in NYC, and its upper west side location, providing a quieter, more residential experience, close to Central Park. Some rooms feature balconies, and the hotel offers amenities like free internet, a DVD library, and access to a nearby swimming pool.

The Muse Hotel is a modern, trendy boutique hotel with spacious rooms compared to other New York hotels, located a half block from Times Square. It has a number of amenities including comfortable beds with high-quality linens, and Aveda bath products.
The New York Helmsley has some rooms with views of the Chrysler Building and Empire State Building and offers spacious rooms for a NYC hotel. The hotel is located close to Grand Central Station.

The New Yorker Hotel is an art-deco style hotel with impressive lobbies, express elevators to upper floors, comfortable beds, and small rooms that have been recently refurbished. The hotel is centrally located near Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Macy's, and various subway lines.

The Pierre is an iconic, old-world style hotel located across from Central Park, featuring elevator operators and recent renovations that blend classic charm with modern amenities. Some rooms have small bathrooms, and some guests have noted issues with noise from air conditioning or nearby construction.

The Plaza Hotel is in an excellent location, right on Central Park, and offers exceptional levels of service from all levels of personnel; rooms are well appointed in a traditional style which has tried to recapture some of the original Plaza hotel with the addition of modern hi tech flat screen TVs and iPod docks. Some rooms have huge bathrooms with gold plated fixtures, and some suites include a private butler.

The Pod Hotel is a funky and modern, budget-friendly hotel with small but well-designed rooms, iPod docks, and shared or private bathrooms, located in Midtown East Manhattan near subway lines and various attractions. Some unique features include a rooftop garden, a French bistro, and well-organized small spaces.

The Premier is a boutique hotel within the Millennium Broadway, offering modern, serene rooms and a complimentary continental breakfast and evening reception. Some rooms offer views of the Chrysler Building and Times Square, and the location is steps from Times Square.

The Ritz-Carlton Central Park is known for its prime location across from Central Park, luxurious rooms, high-end amenities like Frederic Fekkai toiletries, and exceptional service. Some unique services and amenities mentioned are complimentary shoe shining, a house Bentley car, and a club lounge with various food and drink presentations.

The Roosevelt Hotel is a grand, old-style hotel with a beautiful lobby, located in midtown Manhattan near Grand Central Station. It's known for its historical charm, but some rooms may be small, dated, and noisy.

The Sherry-Netherland is a small, luxurious hotel with individually owned and decorated rooms, offering a unique, apartment-like experience with features like fresh flowers, chocolates, and well-stocked kitchens. It is located on Fifth Avenue, directly across from Central Park, and provides attentive service, including elevator operators and personalized greetings.

The Shoreham is a modern, trendy boutique hotel with small rooms, a 24-hour cappuccino machine, and a location close to Central Park and 5th Avenue shopping. Some rooms feature massage chairs, and upgraded rooms are recommended to avoid small spaces and street noise.

The St. Regis is known for its luxurious rooms, butler service, and prime location on 5th Avenue, making it a preferred choice for a high-end experience. The hotel has elegant public areas and classically decorated rooms.

The Standard Hotel in New York's Meatpacking District stands out with its architecture, floor-to-ceiling windows with views, uniquely designed rooms, and video art in the elevators. Its location above the High Line provides a distinctive experience.

The Surrey is a boutique hotel on the Upper East Side of New York City, near Central Park and museums, with large suites that include kitchenettes. The hotel has undergone renovations to modernize its rooms and bathrooms, and the staff is noted for being friendly and helpful.

The Sylvan Guest House is located in a historical Harlem neighborhood near a metro stop and grocery store, offering apartments with well-equipped kitchens, and unique African art decor. It is situated on Sylvan Terrace, near the Jumel Mansion, Manhattan's oldest house.

The Time Hotel, a modern boutique hotel with color-themed rooms, is located in the heart of the Theater District near Times Square and offers amenities like Bose radios, Molton Brown toiletries, and sometimes complimentary drinks. While praised for its location, the hotel is also described as having small, sometimes noisy, and occasionally worn rooms, with mixed reviews regarding cleanliness and service consistency.

The Waldorf Astoria is a landmark hotel with an opulent art deco lobby and ballrooms, making it a unique and historic place to stay in NYC. The rooms vary from updated suites to older, smaller rooms, with some reports of peeling wallpaper and small bathrooms.

The Westin New York at Times Square stands out with its heavenly beds, dual-headed showers, and corner rooms that offer views of the Hudson River, Empire State Building and Times Square. The hotel is attached to an entertainment complex, has a Shula's Steakhouse and is located close to theaters and subways.

The Thirty Thirty Hotel is noted for its location, small rooms, and mixed reviews, with some guests reporting a basic but clean experience while others describe issues with cleanliness, small rooms, and rude staff. Some reviewers mentioned that rooms at the hotel are allocated to "tenants" and former residents of a women's residence.

The Thompson LES is a modern, trendy hotel with floor-to-ceiling windows offering great views of Manhattan; the hotel is located in the Lower East Side, close to many restaurants and shops. Some reviewers noted the hotel was still under construction during their stay with amenities like the pool, bar, and fitness center not yet open.

The Travel Inn is a budget-friendly hotel with free parking, a pool, and a convenient location near Times Square, but some guests have reported issues with noise, small bathrooms, and inconsistent service. It is an older building located across the street from a police station.

The Tribeca Grand is a trendy and stylish hotel with a central atrium that can get noisy on weekends, but offers well-equipped rooms, pet-friendly policies, and a convenient downtown location close to Soho and various subway lines. Unique amenities include the availability of goldfish for the rooms, Bose sound systems, and a screening room.

The Trump International Hotel and Tower, located at Columbus Circle and Central Park, features spacious rooms with kitchens, high-end amenities, and spectacular views. The hotel is known for its excellent service, with staff often going above and beyond to meet guest needs, and a location convenient to many attractions.

The Tudor Hotel is a historic landmark with recent renovations, known for its good location near Grand Central Terminal and the UN. The rooms are small but have comfortable bedding and updated bathrooms; suites with terraces are also available.

The Vincci Avalon, now the Avalon Hotel, is centrally located near the Empire State Building and subway lines, offering spacious rooms, including suites with multiple beds and separate living areas, appealing to families and groups. While some found the hotel dated with occasional maintenance and service issues, many praised the helpful staff and the availability of amenities such as free Wi-Fi and breakfast.

W New York - The Court is a boutique hotel with uniquely decorated rooms and a cozy "living room" style lobby, though some find the decor worn; suites are available with views of the Chrysler Building. The Acura car service, with brand new Acura SUVs, provides free drop-offs in the city.

The W Tuscany is known for its large rooms, which are considered spacious for New York City standards, and its location in the Murray Hill area near Grand Central Station. Some reviewers note the hotel's decor is modern, though the bathrooms and some aspects of the building may show their age.

The W Times Square is a trendy, modern hotel with a prime location in the heart of Times Square, featuring sleek decor, comfortable beds, and views of the city. It stands out with its cascading waterfall entrance, lobby bar scene, and Blissful bathrooms.

The W Union Square stands out with stylish and modern decor, spacious rooms, and comfortable beds, although some found it overpriced. The hotel's location near Union Square, with its market and subway access, also makes it a convenient base for exploring New York City.

The Waldorf Towers, connected to the Waldorf Astoria, offers spacious suites, some with views of the Chrysler Building and East River, and includes access to the Astoria Lounge. The hotel has a private entrance and is known for its classic decor and old-world charm.

The Wall Street Inn is a small, quiet, and clean boutique hotel in the Financial District with a European-style design and rooms that have been recently upgraded. It offers a continental breakfast, free Wi-Fi, and is located near subway stations and historic sites.

The Warwick stands out as a historic hotel in a central location, close to Central Park, Times Square, and MOMA, with large rooms for NYC standards, though some are dark with views of brick walls. Cary Grant lived in this hotel for 12 years.

The Washington Jefferson Hotel is known for its small, but clean and modern rooms, and its prime location near Times Square and the Theater District. Some rooms have unique features such as jacuzzi tubs, iPod docks, and brick wall views, while the building itself has an older infrastructure with a small, slow elevator.

The Washington Square Hotel stands out due to its Greenwich Village location, proximity to Washington Square Park and NYU, and historic art deco design, offering a unique, non-chain hotel experience. Its small scale and European-style charm make it different from larger, more impersonal hotels in NYC.

The Wellington Hotel has an Art Deco lobby, but many reviewers note that the rest of the hotel is old-fashioned and shabby. Some reviewers got free upgrades to suites, and other rooms feature kitchenettes or balconies.

The Hilton Grand Vacation Club West 57th Street is a new property with modern decor, studio apartment-style rooms, and technological enhancements. It features an owners lounge with complimentary breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvres, and is located near Central Park and Carnegie Hall.

The Wingate Inn is praised for its excellent location, cleanliness, and modern amenities, including free Wi-Fi, breakfast, and spacious rooms relative to other Manhattan hotels; some guests have noted noise issues and occasional service inconsistencies.

The Wolcott Hotel is a centrally located, turn-of-the-century budget hotel with a grand lobby, but with old, basic, and small rooms. The hotel is near the Empire State Building and other attractions, and offers free muffins and coffee.

Woogo Central Park Apartments offers apartment-style accommodations with kitchenettes, attracting those seeking a more local NYC living experience rather than a traditional hotel stay. The location near the 72nd Street subway stop and Central Park is frequently highlighted, but reviews mention inconsistent cleanliness, occasional maintenance issues, and limited hotel-like services.

The Wyndham Garden Hotel - Times Square South is a new, modern, and clean hotel with well-designed rooms, known for its friendly staff, comfortable beds, and excellent service. It also offers a variety of amenities, such as free Wi-Fi, Starbucks coffee in the lobby, and a restaurant with organic food options.
